title: Punjab Bandh LIVE updates: Farmers' call shows impact in Haryana, public transport impacted - Hindustan Times
summary:
Punjab Bandh LIVE updates: Farmers' call shows impact in Haryana, public transport impacted

Date: December 30, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The farmers in Punjab are observing a bandh as part of their continuous agitation for increased MSP and other demands. The protests have severely affected traffic on both roads and railways, particularly impacting neighboring Haryana.

  • Over 200 trains have been canceled or rescheduled due to the bandh.
  • The bandh is from 7 AM to 4 PM, with emergency services remaining operational.
  • Protestors have organized community meals for commuters affected by the disruptions.
  • Farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal is on a hunger strike, having entered the 35th day.
  • The bandh has led to significant blockades across Punjab, with more than 280 reported.
“Farming is not our profession as Punjabis, it is our religion…” - Amrinder Singh Raja Warring, Ludhiana MP.

The ongoing protests highlight the farmers' demands for legal guarantees on crop MSP, debt waivers, pensions for agricultural workers, and various other issues that affect their livelihoods.
newTitle: Punjab Bandh: Farmers' Protests Impact Transport and Commuters in Haryana

title: Allu Arjun stampede case: Decision on counter police affidavit opposing the bail pushed to January 3 - TOI Etimes
summary:
Allu Arjun Stampede Case Update: Bail Decision Delayed to January 3

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: India Today

A Hyderabad court has postponed the verdict on the bail application of actor Allu Arjun in connection to the Pushpa 2 stampede case to January 3.

  • Allu Arjun was involved in a stampede incident during the premiere of 'Pushpa-2' where a woman died and her son was injured.
  • The actor appeared via video conference as the hearing for his bail came up.
  • He was arrested on December 13 and granted interim bail on December 14.
  • The police sought time to oppose his bail, leading to a new hearing date set for December 30.
“A 35-year-old woman died and her eight-year-old son was injured on December 4 during a stampede-like situation.”

The court's decision on this high-profile case is anticipated as it involves serious allegations and public interest.
newTitle: Allu Arjun Stampede Case Update: Bail Decision Delayed to January 3

title: Delhi polls: Kejriwal announces scheme to give ₹18,000 per month to priests, granthis - CNBCTV18
summary:
Kejriwal Introduces ₹18,000 Monthly Scheme for Priests Ahead of Delhi Elections

Date: Dec 30, 2024 | Source: CNBC TV18

Arvind Kejriwal has announced the Pujari Granthi Samman Yojana, promising ₹18,000 per month to priests and granthis if AAP wins the upcoming elections. This initiative is part of his broader Revdi Par Charcha campaign aimed at securing voter support.

  • The scheme aims to honor temple priests and granthis in Delhi.
  • Kejriwal described the payment as a token of respect rather than a salary.
  • Registration for the scheme starts on December 31 at Hanuman Temple, Connaught Place.
  • Other promised initiatives include enhancements in welfare schemes, healthcare improvements, and assistance for the middle class.
  • Kejriwal has announced free healthcare for seniors, increased financial aid for women, and various guarantees for rickshaw drivers.
Kejriwal stated, "A priest is a part of all of our family occasions... happy or sad; they are the ones who have carried forward the rituals from generation to generation. However, they have never paid attention to their families... and neither have we."

This announcement is part of AAP's strategy to maintain power in the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections, focusing on fulfilling basic needs of citizens.
newTitle: Kejriwal Introduces ₹18,000 Monthly Scheme for Priests Ahead of Delhi Elections

title: ‘You take blankets from us and then show us attitude’: Heated exchange between Prashant Kishor and BPSC aspirants - Hindustan Times
summary:
Heated Exchange Between Prashant Kishor and BPSC Aspirants

Publication Date: Dec 30, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

BPSC aspirants protested at Gandhi Maidan, demanding a re-examination of the 70th BPSC preliminary exam and a meeting with Nitish Kumar. A heated exchange occurred between students and Prashant Kishor when aspirants accused him of being absent during police action against the protesters.

  • Students accused Kishor of being absent when police used water cannons and batons against them.
  • Kishor arrived at the scene and faced angry protesters who demanded he step away.
  • Kishor's remark, "You take blankets from us and then show us attitude," escalated tensions.
  • The protest began on Dec 13, gaining support from politicians, educationists, and activists.
Protesters asked, "Where was Prashant Kishor during the lathicharge?"

After his eviction, Kishor addressed a press conference, refuting allegations, reaffirming support for the students' cause, and condemning police action. He plans to file an FIR against Patna Police and join the protest if no resolution is reached.
newTitle: Heated Exchange Between Prashant Kishor and BPSC Aspirants: Students Allege Absence During Police Action

title: 'Deference to privacy': Congress shares why Gandhi family didn't accompany Manmohan Singh’s kin for immer - The Times of India
'Deference to privacy': Congress shares why Gandhi family didn't accompany Manmohan Singh’s kin for immersion of ashes - The Times of India
summary:
Congress Explains Gandhi Family's Absence at Manmohan Singh’s Ashes Immersion

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: Not specified

The Congress party has addressed the absence of the Gandhi family during the immersion of the ashes of Manmohan Singh's kin, emphasizing their respect for privacy.

  • The Gandhi family did not attend the ceremony to maintain privacy.
  • Congress leaders expressed their understanding of the situation and highlighted the importance of privacy in such personal matters.
  • The event raised questions about the family's involvement in significant political and social rituals.
“Respect for privacy is fundamental in times of personal loss.”

This incident reinforces the need for privacy during sensitive family events, particularly within political families.
newTitle: Congress Explains Gandhi Family's Absence at Manmohan Singh’s Ashes Immersion

title: Amid Row Over Schemes, Arvind Kejriwal Launches New 'Yojana' For Priests, To Give Rs 18,000 A Month - News18
summary:
Arvind Kejriwal's New 'Yojana' Promises Rs 18k A Month To Priests Amid Women's Scheme Row

Date & Source: Last Updated: December 30, 2024, 18:42 IST

Introduction: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday announced a new scheme, 'Pujari Granthi Samman Yojana', under which the priests of temples and the 'granthis' of the Gurudwara will be paid a monthly honorarium of nearly Rs 18,000. This announcement comes just two months before the Delhi Assembly polls, with the BJP reacting sharply and calling it a 'deception'.

  • Kejriwal's new scheme aims to benefit priests and granthis.
  • The BJP has criticized the announcement, saying it is a pre-election stunt.
  • The 'Mahila Samman Yojana' row, involving allegations of data fraud and election interference, remains a contentious issue.

…

Conclusion: The announcement of the 'Pujari Granthi Samman Yojana' has sparked a political row in Delhi, with the BJP calling it a deceptive move by the AAP. The upcoming Assembly polls have brought various schemes and promises to the forefront, with both parties trying to gain an edge.
newTitle: Arvind Kejriwal's New 'Yojana' Benefits Priests Ahead of Delhi Polls

Manipur violence: Security forces destroy four bunkers after gunfights - The Hindu
summary:
Manipur Violence: Security Forces Destroy Four Bunkers After Gunfights

Date & Source: December 30, 2024, The Hindu

Security forces have destroyed four bunkers and occupied three others in Manipur's Imphal East and Kangpokpi districts following gunfights with armed miscreants, police said on Monday. The operations were conducted in areas bordering Thamnapokpi and Sanasabi villages where gunfights took place.

  • Four illegal bunkers have been destroyed.
  • Three bunkers have been occupied by security forces.
  • The dominant areas in Uyok Ching in Kangpokpi district have also been occupied.

On Friday, four persons, including police personnel and a woman, were injured in gun attacks in Thamnapokpi and Sanasabi villages. More than 250 people have been killed and thousands rendered homeless in ethnic violence between Meiteis and Kuki-Zo groups in Manipur since May last year.
newTitle: Security Forces Demolish Bunkers, Occupy Positions After Manipur Gunfights

title: Security forces destroy four bunkers after gunfights in Manipur - The Hindu
summary:
Security forces destroy four bunkers after gunfights in Manipur

Date: December 30, 2024

Source: The Hindu

Security forces in Manipur have successfully destroyed four bunkers used by gunmen following intense gunfights in the region. The operations took place in Imphal East and Kangpokpi districts, with authorities reporting major security advancements.

  • Four gunman bunkers were destroyed, while three were occupied by security forces.
  • The operations were focused in Thamnapokpi and Sanasabi villages, where multiple gunfights occurred.
  • Injuries reported included four individuals, among them police personnel.
  • The conflict in the area has led to severe ethnic violence, with over 250 casualties since May 2023.
“All armed miscreants involved in recent firing incidents at Thamnapokpi and Sanasabi have been flushed out.”

The ongoing military operations highlight the escalating situation in Manipur, stemming from ethnic violence that has left many dead and displaced. Continued efforts are crucial for restoring peace in the region.
newTitle: Security Forces Neutralize Threat in Manipur by Destroying Bunkers

title: BRO Various Post Offline Form 2024 - Last Date Today - SarkariExam.com
‘Nitish’s B-team’: Tejashwi Yadav slams Prashant Kishor's party, claims protesting BPSC aspirants' were ‘misled’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Tejashwi Yadav Accuses Prashant Kishor's Party of Being 'B-Team' of Nitish Kumar's Alliance

Date & Source: Dec 30, 2024 | Hindustan Times

Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav has accused the newly-formed Jan Suraaj Party by Prashant Kishor of functioning as the ‘B team’ of Nitish Kumar's ruling alliance in Bihar. Yadav made this accusation after police used water cannons to disperse students protesting the recent BPSC exam, an event in which Kishor and his supporters were involved.

  • Yadav alleged that the protesters were misled into marching towards Gandhi Maidan and faced police action.
  • He promised political support for the protesters' demand for the cancellation of the Combined Competitive Exams held on December 13.
  • An FIR was filed against Kishor, Jan Suraaj Party president Manoj Bharti, and several others for their involvement in the protests.

Yadav warned the protesters not to be swayed by empty promises and to stick to their demands, as the BPSC comes under the government's control.

With PTI inputs
newTitle: Tejashwi Yadav Accuses Prashant Kishor's Party of Being 'B-Team' of Nitish Kumar's Alliance

Isro set to launch PSLV-C60 Spadex Space Docking mission at 10pm today - The Times of India
summary:
ISRO Set to Launch PSLV-C60 Spadex Space Docking Mission Tonight

Publication Date: Today

Source: ISRO

The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) is preparing for the launch of the PSLV-C60 Spadex Space Docking mission scheduled for 10 PM this evening. This mission aims to enhance India's capabilities in space docking technologies.

  • The PSLV-C60 is equipped with advanced space docking features.
  • ISRO continues to push forward in space technology innovation.
  • The mission reflects India's growing ambitions in the space sector.
"This mission marks a significant step in our space exploration efforts." - ISRO Official

The PSLV-C60 mission is a critical development for future space missions, showcasing advancements in India's space technology and reinforcing its position in global space exploration.
newTitle: ISRO Set to Launch PSLV-C60 Spadex Space Docking Mission Tonight

title: ISRO reschedules PSLV-C60 Space Docking Experiment mission by 2 minutes - The Hindu
summary:
ISRO Reschedules PSLV-C60 Mission Launch Time by 2 Minutes

Published: December 30, 2024, Source: The Hindu

The PSLV-C60 rocket is set to launch two minutes later than originally planned, marking a key milestone in India’s space program. The launch will now occur at 10 pm instead of 9:58 pm.

  • The PSLV-C60 mission includes a Space Docking Experiment, essential for future human spaceflight and satellite servicing missions.
  • ISRO announced that the two spacecraft involved will be spaced 5 km apart initially, with plans to bring them within 3 meters of each other.
  • This mission aims to establish India's capability in orbital docking, positioning it alongside global powers like China, Russia, and the U.S.
  • ISRO's last mission of 2024, it carries two primary payloads and 24 secondary payloads, demonstrating cost-effective technology.
"Launch Day is here. Tonight at precisely 10 pm, PSLV-C60 with SpaDeX and innovative payloads are set for liftoff." - ISRO

This event represents a significant step for ISRO and India’s aspirations in space exploration, particularly as it prepares for future missions, including those involving human spaceflight and the establishment of its own space station.
newTitle: ISRO Reschedules PSLV-C60 Mission Launch Time by 2 Minutes

'Water cannon, lathi charge in this harsh cold inhuman': Priyanka Gandhi Vadra slams Bihar govt over BPSC - The Times of India
summary:
Water cannon, lathi charge in this harsh cold inhuman: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra slams Bihar govt over BPSC protests

Published on: [Insert Publication Date Here] | Source: Times of India

Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has condemned the inhumane actions of the Bihar government in response to the ongoing BPSC protests, highlighting the use of water cannons and lathi charges against demonstrators.

  • Priyanka Gandhi expressed her outrage over police brutality during the protests.
  • She called the government's actions in the harsh winter ''inhuman''.
  • Gandhi criticized the lack of support offered to the protesting students and job seekers.
  • The protests erupted over demands for a fair BPSC examination and recruitment process.
“Using force against young aspirants for jobs is unacceptable and shows the government's disdain for the youth's future.” - Priyanka Gandhi Vadra

This incident has sparked widespread discussion about the treatment of protesters and the responsibilities of the government in ensuring a peaceful dialogue.

Punjab bandh farmers protest: Commuter traffic crippled; rail, bus service suspended - The Hindu
summary:
Punjab bandh farmers protest: Commuter traffic crippled; rail, bus service suspended

Date: December 30, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Life was significantly disrupted in Punjab due to a statewide bandh called by farmers demanding a legal guarantee for minimum support prices (MSP) for their crops.

  • Rail and road traffic were heavily affected, leading to the suspension of various services.
  • Commercial establishments remained closed throughout the state.
  • Farmers conducted sit-ins on key roads, causing major traffic disruptions.
  • Emergency services were exempted from the bandh restrictions.
  • Farmer leaders claimed the bandh received wide support from different community groups.
“All establishments are closed. Punjabis have shown their unity today and they are extending full support,” claimed farmer leader Sarwan Singh Pandher.

The protest reflects the ongoing tensions between farmers and the central government regarding agricultural policies.
newTitle: Punjab Bandh: Farmers Protest Disrupts Commuter Traffic and Services

Kerala: Congress MLA Uma Thomas in ICU after falling 15 ft at Kochi's Jawahar Lal Nehru Stadium - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kerala Congress MLA Uma Thomas in Critical Condition After 15-Foot Fall

Date: Dec 30, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Congress MLA from Kerala's Thrikkakara, Uma Thomas, is currently on ventilator support after suffering injuries to her head and spine from a fall at a stadium.

  • MLA fell approximately 15 feet from the VIP gallery of the Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium.
  • She was rushed to a private hospital with severe bleeding.
  • A medical bulletin stated her vital signs are stable, but she requires ongoing ventilator support due to lung injuries.
  • The CT scan revealed a cervical spine fracture and stabilized head injury.
  • Health officials are monitoring her progress closely with an expert team on site.
"At the beginning, we thought it was a grave situation." - Kerala Leader of Opposition VD Satheesan

Kerala officials are optimistic about her recovery and are actively managing her treatment.
newTitle: Kerala Congress MLA Uma Thomas in Critical Condition After 15-Foot Fall

title: Diljit Dosanjh dedicates Guwahati concert to late Manmohan Singh, talks about tackling tough situations. Watch - Hindustan Times
summary:
Diljit Dosanjh Dedicates Guwahati Concert to Late Manmohan Singh

Date: Dec 30, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Singer Diljit Dosanjh dedicated his concert in Guwahati to the late Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, encouraging the youth to learn from Singh's ability to handle tough situations amidst criticism.

  • Diljit shared a quote from Manmohan Singh about the power of silence over harsh words.
  • He emphasized focusing on goals despite negative comments from others.
  • Manmohan Singh passed away recently at the age of 92 after a prolonged illness.
Agar main unki life ki journey ki taraf dekhu, toh unhone itna saada jeewan jia hai. Agar unko kisi ne bura bhi bola, toh unhone kabhi ulta jawaab nhi diya. (If I look at his life, he led a very simple one. Even if someone spoke ill about him, he never answered back.)

This tribute highlights the values of resilience and dedication that both Diljit and Singh embodied.
newTitle: Diljit Dosanjh Dedicates Guwahati Concert to Manmohan Singh

title: FIR against Prashant Kishore, 700 people for 'organising' BPSC protest without 'permission' - The Times of India
summary:
FIR against Prashant Kishore, 700 people for 'organising' BPSC protest without 'permission'

Date: October 2023, Source: Various

An FIR has been lodged against political strategist Prashant Kishore and nearly 700 individuals for allegedly organizing a protest related to the Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) without necessary permissions.

  • The FIR accuses the group of instigating unrest by protesting without official approval.
  • The protest was aimed at demanding justice for aspirants affected by BPSC examinations.
  • The action has raised questions about the legality of the protest and implications for protesters.
  • Authorities emphasize the importance of obtaining necessary permissions for public demonstrations.
"Public protests must be conducted within the framework of the law to maintain order and safety." - Local Authorities

This incident highlights the ongoing tension between aspirants and examination authorities, stressing the need for clarity in communication and organization during protests.
newTitle: FIR Filed Against Prashant Kishore and 700 Others for Unauthorized BPSC Protest

title: 300 km, 21 days, 3 states — Zeenat’s journey interrupted with a tranquiliser gun, officials hope tigress stays in Odisha this time - The Indian Express
summary:
Tigress Zeenat's Journey Ends with Capture

Date: December 10, 2024

Source: The Indian Express

Tigress Zeenat was captured in West Bengal after a 21-day journey that took her through three states, following her wandering from the Similipal Tiger Reserve in Odisha. Forest officials confirmed her health is stable, and they plan to return her to her original habitat.

  • Zeenat was tranquilised and captured near Gosaindihi village in Bankura district, West Bengal.
  • She traveled 300 kilometers through Odisha, Jharkhand, and West Bengal during her journey.
  • A 15-member team from Odisha's Forest Department collaborated with West Bengal officials for the capture.
  • She will be kept in a soft enclosure in Similipal for adaptation before being released again in a different area than before.
  • The initiative is aimed at improving the genetic diversity of tigers in the region.
  • Similipal currently hosts around 27 tigers, including 13 melanistic tigers according to the latest count.
“We will keep the tigress in a soft enclosure within the Similipal core area and keep it there for a longer period to ensure that it can better adapt to the region.” – P K Jha, Principal Chief Conservator of Forest (Wildlife)

The successful capture is part of ongoing efforts to ensure the survival and health of tigers in Odisha.
newTitle: Tigress Zeenat's Journey Ends with Capture, Officials Hope for Successful Return to Similipal
